content:
• Monday, May 19, 2014
  • PWRD

    Perfect World offers in-line guidance; PC users drop Q/Q in Q1

    • Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD) expects Q2 revenue of RMB891M-RMB936M ($142.7M-$150M) vs. a $148.2M consensus.
    • Revenue rose 42.5% Y/Y in Q1, but also fell 2.5% Q/Q, thanks in part to lower promotional spend for MMORPG titles. Average concurrent PC users fell 18% Q/Q to 662K, something attributed to anti-cheating efforts and seasonality. Mobile gaming growth partly offset the decline.
    • Gross margin fell to 73.6% from 75.1% in Q4 and 77.8% a year ago. Opex rose 41% Y/Y to $77M.
    • PWRD +0.3% AH. Q1 results, PR.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CLVS +6.0%. MONT +3.3%. MLP +3.1%. RDY +2.7%. DKS +1.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ENSV -5.2%. URBN -4.3%. ATML -4.0%. APA -3.9%. ARTX -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • PWRD

    Perfect World beats by $0.14, beats on revenue

    • Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q1 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.14.
    • Revenue of $143.3M (+42.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.6M.
    • Shares +1.15% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • CS

    Credit Suisse to reportedly plead guilty to tax evasion charge

    • As expected, the DOJ has filed a criminal complaint against Credit Suisse (NYSE:CS) that accuses the bank of aiding tax evasion.
    • CS will reportedly plead guilty and agree to a multi-billion dollar fine. A hearing is set for 5:30PM ET.
    • Earlier: Credit Suisse tax deal expected today.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • TEDU

    Tarena International EPS of $0.01 in-line, beats on revenue

    • Tarena International (NASDAQ:TEDU): Q1 EPS of $0.01 in-line.
    • Revenue of $24.3M (+60.7% Y/Y) beats by $1.22M.
    • Shares +4.47% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • URBN

    Margins tighten at Urban Outfitters

    • Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) reports comparable-store sales were flat during Q1.
    • Sales growth by brand: Urban Outfitters -5.4% to $277,6M; Anthropologie Group +10.3% to $295,8M; Free People +30% to $108.6M.
    • Gross profit rate -200 bps to 34.8%.
    • SG&A expenses +7.7% to $178.7M.
    • The company's inventory was up 7% compared to a year ago.
    • URBN -2.9% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • INFN

    Infinera +12% after CFO discloses purchase

    • Infinera (INFN +12.1%) CFO Brad Feller bought 25K shares at $8.25 on Friday. He's up 14% on that investment following today's move.
    • Feller's move is Infinera's first disclosed insider buy since CEO Thomas Fallon made a string of purchases in 2012.
    • 12% of Infinera's short was floated as of April 30. The company delivered a Q1 beat and solid Q2 guidance last month, but quickly gave back its post-earnings gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • EGC

    Energy XXI +2% as insider buys 53K shares, Raymond James upgrades

    • Energy XXI (EXXI +2.1%) shares have been strong all day, as an executive VP discloses the purchase of 53.3K shares, worth a total $1.1M, earlier today and on Friday.
    • Also, Raymond James upgrades shares to Strong Buy from Outperform with a $29 price target, citing valuation and potential upside from the soon-to-close merger with EPL Oil & Gas (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar slips following Roth PT cut

    • Roth has cut its Canadian Solar (CSIQ -1.8%) PT by $15 to $35 after the company posted mixed Q1 results and offered light Q2 revenue guidance. The firm's Buy rating is unchanged.
    • Shares are missing out on a tech stock rally that includes several solar peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • FEYE

    FireEye +7%; Nomura reiterates Buy ahead of lockup expiration

    • Nomura's Rick Sherlund thinks investor sentiment towards FireEye (FEYE +7%) will improve following the company's big May 21 lockup expiration (will lead 68% of shares to become eligible for sale).
    • He also calls FireEye's technology platform (evolving as the company digests multiple acquisitions) "best-of-breed," and praises its management team and market opportunity.
    • Shares are within a hair's breadth of $30 two trading days after making a fresh post-IPO low of $25.58. Plenty of other tech stocks with high betas and/or short interests are also rallying today.
    • Previous: Zulily jumps after lockup expires; FireEye due in a week
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 5 Comments
  • NEON

    Neonode spikes on insider buy

    • Neonode (NEON +5.1%) director Mats Dahlin discloses he bought 50K shares today at $3.77.
    • The purchase comes a month after CEO Thomas Eriksson bought 20K shares at $5.08.
    • Separately Neonode announced this morning it has closed its $10M private placement (previous).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • NEWL

    NewLead shares nearly triple as handysize vessel is delivered

    • NewLead Holdings (NEWL +238.3%) skyrockets after announcing its dry bulk, eco-type handysize vessel, NewLead Albion, had been delivered to the company's fleet.
    • The Newlead Albion is one of the two eco-type vessels NEWL agreed to acquire in March for $18.5N each; NEWL says the market value of each vessel is now ~$20.25M, and expects the second vessel to be delivered to its fleet this July.
    • The eco-type ships are both more fuel-efficient and emit less carbon dioxide than earlier vessels.
    • NEWL expects the ship to generate $2M/year EBITDA.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • ITMN

    Investors like pirfenidone Phase 3 results

    • Shares of Intermune (ITMN +14.6%) jump on a 5x surge in volume in response to its report on positive results for its perfenidone Phase 3 clinical trial.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: EONC +39%. IMI +38%. FORD +21%. SBSA +20%. ITMN +16%. RIBT +11%. ACET +11%. SNMX +11%. INFN +11%. PULS-OLD +11%.
    • Top 10 Losers: LOCK -18%. HOTR -17%. VTUS -12%. AZN -11%. CNR -10%. OTC:PRKR -10%. CJJD -9%. MBII -9%. HPJ -8%. YOD -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • AEP

    Ohio asks feds to audit power generators, American Electric Power -2.7%

    • Following a winter of forced power outages, Ohio's Public Utilities Commission is urging federal regulators to audit power generators’ claimed capabilities.
    • Heavy winter use strained the capacity of regional transmission organizations and electric companies such as American Electric Power (AEP -2.7%) and led to, at times, 22% (40K MW) of forced outages for generating capacity vs. the average rate of 7%.
    • The Ohio group says the increased outage rates are proof that generating units are not being properly maintained to ensure that they work during peak demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 4 Comments
  • PRKR

    ParkerVision -9.9%; SA author offers critical view of May 1 hearing

    • After reading a transcript of the proceedings, SA author Alpha Exposure believes ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR -9.9%) attorney Joshua Budwin "made potentially critical errors" during a May 1 court hearing related to the company's Qualcomm suit.
    • The author notes Qualcomm argues the fact the baseband signal from its processors is generated before a capacitor and not after is "fatal to ParkerVision's infringement case," and thinks the judge presiding over the case (Judge Dalton) "appears to agree."
    • Alpha Exposure adds Dalton was "unsatisfied" with Budwin's defense against Qualcomm's argument, and that Qualcomm lawyer Stephen Neal stated the company is developing 28nm chips that don't infringe ParkerVision's IP. The author thinks a 28nm RF transceiver announced last November (set to ship in commercial devices in early 2015) fits the bill.
    • Previous: ParkerVision higher after new Qualcomm suit, court rulings
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • IVAN

    Ivanhoe Energy names Phaneuf new CFO, shares +9.5%

    • Ivanhoe Energy (IVAN +9.5%) recoups all its losses from Friday as it names Greg Phaneuf as its new CFO, replacing Gerald Schiefelbein, who announced Friday he would leave IVAN effective May 31 to accept a leadership role with another company.
    • Phaneuf brings 23 years' experience in the financial and energy sectors, and has spent four years at IVAN as Senior VP for Business Development and Corporate Strategy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • LOCK

    LifeLock -17% after pulling Wallet app on security fears

    • After concluding "certain aspects" of LifeLock's (LOCK -17%) Wallet app "may not be fully compliant with payment card industry (PCI) security standards," the company has pulled the app from mobile app stores and "taken steps to delete all stored information for the mobile app from [its] servers" as a precaution.
    • The widely-used app has its roots in LifeLock's $42M December acquisition of app developer Lemon, and supports the company's subscription-based identity theft-protection services.
    • LifeLock asserts its move doesn't affect those services, and that it will be "working to return a Wallet with the highest level of PCI compliance to users soon."
    • Security industry vet Graham Cluley thinks pulling the app was "the right thing to do," but also expects some fallout. "This is going to be a headache for some LifeLock users, who may have put passwords and PIN codes into their LifeLock app hoping that the service would remember them on their behalf."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 3 Comments
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto closing in on $20B Simandou deal, Walsh says

    • Rio Tinto (RIO -1.8%) CEO Sam Walsh said over the weekend he expects to sign an investment framework this month for the stalled $20B Simandou iron ore project in Guinea, which would be Africa's largest-ever ­infrastructure project.
    • Walsh believes the planned 100M metric tons/year project can sustain a mine life in excess of 40 years and has the potential to make Guinea one of the world's top iron ore exporters.
    • Simandou, the world's largest untapped high grade iron ore resource, has been a troublesome investment for Rio, which is wrapped up in corruption allegations with Vale in a U.S. court.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella +4.2% on Ascendiant coverage launch, GoPro hopes

    • Citing the potential impact of a GoPro IPO, Ascendiant Capital has launched coverage of Ambarella (AMBA +4.2%) at Buy, and set a $30 PT.
    • The video-processing SoC vendor has gradually trended lower since early March amid a momentum stock selloff. Over 16% of the float was shorted as of April 30.
    • The Street is still waiting for top GoPro, which confidentially filed for an IPO earlier this year, to nail down its IPO plans. Re/code has reported the top Ambarella customer could file a public S-1 as soon as this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • DO

    Diamond Offshore upgraded at Global Hunter, market sentiment too one-sided

    • Diamond Offshore (DO +1.8%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell with a $48 price target, up from $37, at Global Hunter.
    • The firm thinks market sentiment has become too one-sided against the stock even as it says it understands the bearish case: DO has an aging fleet, its 2014 rig turnover is high, contracting activity has lapsed, and Petrobras remains a source of frustration.
    • Still, Global Hunter believes these points are widely accepted and that potential balancing factors are disregarded.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • ROC

    Rockwood rallies on investor presentation

    • Rockwood Holdings (ROC +2.2%) shares move higher after the company disclosed slides for its investor presentation, highlighting its solid balance sheet with no debt and goal of 20% annual average earnings growth.
    • ROC said it plans to allocate cash to accretive acquisitions and to promote organic growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • KEYW

    KEYW Holding +8.9% on Chardan upgrade

    • Citing strong sales of its HawkEye G network threat-protection hardware/software, Chardan Capital has upgraded KEYW Holding (KEYW +8.9%) to Buy. Its PT is at $14.
    • KEYW sold off at the beginning of the month due to a Q1 miss, and (thanks partly to a momentum stock rout) is well below its 52-week high of $23.09.
    • With 23% of the float shorted as of April 30, short-covering is probably playing a big role in today's move.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • NVDA

    RBC turns bullish on Nvidia/Broadcom/Micron/TI/Altera

    • In a bullish call on chip stocks, RBC's Doug Freedman has upgraded Nvidia (NVDA +2.9%), Broadcom (BRCM +1.8%), Micron (MU +3.3%), Texas Instruments (TXN +1.3%), and Altera (ALTR +1.8%) to Outperform.
    • Freedman sees the industry's free cash flow profile improving as it transitions "into a more mature era," and companies embrace more "shareholder-friendly capital-allocation strategies."
    • Nvidia, TI, and Altera have already announced major cash-return efforts in recent years. TI has promised to return all of its FCF to shareholders, save for funds needed to pay down debt.
    • Micron (just digested Elpida) and Broadcom have been more cautious, though the latter did hike its dividend in January.
    • Freedman downgraded Micron on Jan. 3, when shares were at $21.66. He was bullish during the company's big 2012/2013 rally.
    • Chip ETFs: SOXX, SMH, XSD, PSI, SOXL, USD, SOXS, SSG
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBI

    Analysis: Plenty of upside for Pitney Bowes

    • Pitney Bowes (PBI +2.6%) trades higher after Barron's writer Jack Hough indicates in a positive piece that shares could soar over the next three years.
    • The bullish take on PBI is that the profitable postal meter business is still steady, while digital products and services provide new growth channels.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM | 4 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: IMI +15%. STEM +10%. ITMN +6%. SSLT +5%.
    • Losers: AZN -10%. LOCK -7%. CPB -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • AU

    AngloGold +4.8% premarket as Q1 output rises 17%, costs fall 22%

    • AngloGold Ashanti (NYSE:AU) +4.8% premarket after reporting Q1 earnings of $0.29/share.
    • Reports Q1 production rose 17% Y/Y to 1.06M oz. at a total cash cost of $770/oz., AU's strongest Q1 performance in four years, vs. guidance of 950K-1M oz. at a total cash cost of $800-$850/oz.
    • All-in sustaining cost, which includes sustaining capex and corporate and exploration costs, fell 22% Y/Y to $993/oz.
    • AU says higher production and lower costs were aided by continued ramp-up of the two new, low-cost Kibali and Tropicana mines, together with ongoing efficiency improvements across the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOGO

    Gogo +4.1% on UBS upgrade

    • UBS has upgraded GOGO to Buy, and lifted its PT by $3 to $26.
    • The upgrade arrives three days after CEO Michael Small and director Charles Townsend disclosed purchases, and a week after the company beat Q1 estimates and reiterated full-year guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • MBOT

    Two more patients benefit from StemCells technology

    • StemCells (STEM) says that two additional patients have experienced "significant" gains in sensory function after receiving cell transplants using the company's HuCNS-SC (purified human neural stem cells) platform technology for spinal-cord injury. A third subject remained stable.
    • Previously, two patients who had no mobility or sensory perception below the point of injury, experienced improvement in their symptoms. The patients in the latest results are less-severely injured.
    • The subjects are being treated as part of a Phase I/II trial.
    • StemCells' shares are +10.1%. (PR)
    • Previous coverage
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • UL

    Unilever improves capital structure through share rights purchaes

    • Unilever (NYSE:UL) announces it spent $1.2B to purchase share rights held by trusts of one of its original founders.
    • The company says the acquisitions will end up improving its capital structure and add as much as 2% to EPS.
    • UL +1.2% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM | 3 Comments
  • CPB

    Campbell Soup lower after results disappoint

    • Shares of Campbell Soup (NYSE:CPB) are down sharply in early trading after the company sees margins crumble in FQ3 and cuts its growth outlook.
    • Soup sales were disappointing for the company despite the extended cold snap across the U.S. during the winter.
    • CPB -5.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • AVP

    Interest picks up on Avon Products

    • Shares of Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) are higher in early action after the company was mentioned positively in Barron's.
    • Stifel Nicolaus thinks CEO Sheri McCoy is on the right track with cost reduction initiatives. The firm also reasons Avon's North American business should be sold or closed if it can't be turned around.
    • Barron's notes insider buying at Avon has picked up after shares dipped earlier this month.
    • AVP +1.8% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • FWONA

    Liberty Media to nab 3.7M shares of Live Nation through convertible note offering

    • Liberty Media (LMCA) announces it intends to acquire up to 3.7M shares of Live Nation Entertainment (NYSE:LYV).
    • The company is going to snap up the shares through Live Nation's offering of $250M worth of convertible notes.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • LYV -4.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • DISH

    Dish Network in focus after AT&T bids for DirecTV

    • Shares of Dish (NASDAQ:DISH) are mildly higher in early trading following AT&T's purchase of DirecTV.
    • Analysts haven't removed the chance that Dish could come in over the top with a fresh bid for DirecTV, although a partnership or deal with a major telecommunications company is considered a more likely scenario.
    • DISH +0.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca shareholders upset at rejection of Pfizer offer

    • Leading AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) shareholders aren't happy about the company's rebuffing of Pfizer's latest £69B ($117B) offer.
    • Jupiter Fund Management, a top-30 shareholder in the U.K. pharmaceuticals provider, is "disappointed" that the rejection was so categorical. "They should have at least engaged in a constructive conversation...to assess the opportunities that a combined entity could bring," Jupiter says.
    • A fund manager at a top 10 investor says: "We do not think the Astra management have done a good job on behalf of shareholders."
    • AstraZeneca's shares are -12% premarket.
    • Previous coverage
     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 AM | 5 Comments

  • World stocks head lower

    • Global equities are generally lower as sentiment in China gets dragged down by further evidence that the country's property sector is cooling and by new regulations aimed at lowering risks in the shadow-banking sector.
    • The U.K.'s FTSE 100 is -0.8%, pulled lower by AstraZeneca (-12%) after it rejected Pfizer's latest mega-bid.
    • However, Indian shares continue to celebrate Narendra Modi's landslide election win.
    • Japan -0.6%, Hong Kong flat, China -1.05%, India +1.1%.
    • Euro Stoxx 600 -0.75%, Paris -0.7%, Frankfurt -0.7%, Milan -2.6%, Spain -1.35%.
    • U.S. stock futures: Dow -0.4%. S&P -0.4%. Nasdaq -0.4%
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 AM
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca rejects Pfizer's final offer of £69B

    • As tipped, AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) has rejected Pfizer's (NYSE:PFE) final proposal of £55 a share, or £69B ($117B), saying that the bid "falls short of AstraZeneca’s value as an independent science-led company."
    • AstraZeneca told Pfizer on Friday that any offer would have to be over 10% above the latter's previous bid of £53.50.
    • The U.K. company said that while Pfizer's pursuit has been driven by cost and tax savings, it "has failed to make a compelling strategic, business or value case."
    • Pfizer's final proposal "would present significant risks for shareholders, while also having serious consequences for the company, our employees and the life-sciences sector in the U.K., Sweden and the U.S.," AstraZeneca said.
    • AstraZeneca's shares are -13.2% at £41.87 in London. (PR)
    • Previous
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 AM | 10 Comments
